result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Gregory L Wagner in court with attorney Lori Ann Kuehn.  Defendant Gregory L Wagner in custody.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.

AS TO COUNT 1: Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered case dismissed and read-in to case #15CF2537 for the purposes of sentencing.

Defendant Gregory L Wagner in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Gregory L Wagner in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.
